translation:
Most Illustrious Sir

On this date, an order is given to the chief of Police of Alegrete to disarm the emigrants of the United Army, except the officers, and to make all of them march to São Gabriel, to which point the Most Excellent Bento Manuel is said to have sent Your Lordship, in order to put yourself at the head of those same emigrants; consequently, the government orders Your Lordship to keep them there under your supervision, providing them only with rations of meat.

If, to carry out the disarmament of the aforementioned emigrants, the assistance of the armed force is necessary for that chief of police, Your Lordship

May God keep Your Lordship  
Secretary of War Affairs  
Caçapava, January 19, 1840  
Most Illustrious Sir João Antônio da Silveira.  
Serafim Joaquim de Alencastre
